title: Domaine Fond Croze 2014 Cuvée Vincent de Catari Red (Côtes du Rhône Villages)
description: Inviting earth, moss, blackberry and bramble whiffs adorn the nose of this elegant, full-bodied red wine. Its blackberry and plum flavors are ripe but muted, edged by taut, lingering tannins and a crisp acidic backbone.

title: Domaine Maby 2016 Libiamo  (Tavel)
description: Aged nine months in oak, this spicy, vanilla-kissed rosé drinks more like a light red wine than a pool-side quaffer. Densely concentrated in plum and cherry flavors and framed firmly by oak and tannins, it's a structured wine intended for hearty fare. While approachable now, it may drink more seamlessly in the summer of 2019.

title: Fox Run 2014 Lot 11 Hanging Delta Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Earthy in character, this off-dry Riesling shows an exuberance of lemon, lime and sun-baked stone on the nose. The palate is succulent and round in juicy peach, blossoms and honey flavors.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017 Titolato Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This wine's acacia, baked apple, citrus rind and baking spice aromas follow through to the ripe, round palate. It closes on mineral and bitter almond hints.

title: Jäger 2017 Selection Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: Some reduction plays on the nose. The palate comes in with gentle freshness, ease and absolute lightness. This is dry, fresh and has a lovely citrus tanginess on the finish.

title: Jermann 2016 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine's delicate bouquet of white flowers and ripe orchard fruit floats from the glass. The elegant palate delivers white peach, citrus and honeydew melon flavors alongside fresh acidity. A lightly savory mineral note lifts the finish.

title: Kukkula 2015 Noir Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: There's a pleasant array of violets, lilacs, lamb roast, rosemary and dark fruit swirling on the nose of this bottling, with includes 11% Counoise. Ripe boysenberry, a hint of tar and a vanilla-laced syrup arise on the palate, which is dominated by a Concord grape-syrup element that's both thick and tangy.

title: La Ferme du Mont 2015 La Truffière White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: While restrained on the nose, this full-bodied dry white offers creamy yellow apple and tangerine notes accented by cashew and spice. It's not deeply complex, but its lavish, silky texture is lovely. The finish is bright and fresh, with a delicate mineral touch. Drink now–2020.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G Red (Bandol)
description: Packed with spicy, aromatic Mourvèdre, this rich wine is structured and still firm with tannins. Its black fruits are dense, concentrated and darkly textured. This ripe, juicy wine needs to age further. Drink from 2020.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2017 Castel des Maures Cuvée Jeanne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This ripe wine has an herbal edge that gives it a crisp texture. It is packed with red-currant and spice flavors, shot through with refreshing acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Lightwell Survey 2015 Goodbye Horses Riesling (Shenandoah Valley)
description: Aromas of white peach, honeysuckle and geranium follow through to the palate and are met with flavors citrus pith and ginger powder. There is also fullness to the palate and the finish is long and lively with evolving flavors.

title: Mas Carlot 2017 Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: This pretty pink rosé offsets its zesty raspberry and currant flavors with savory lavender, dried herb and bramble tones. It's briskly concentrated but thirst-quenching, with an invigorating crushed stone-laced finish. Drink now.

title: Mas de Cadenet 2017 Nuit Blanche Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Definitely on the pale side, this is a lightly fruity wine, soft and ripe on the palate. It has just the right amount of acidity to balance the ripe red-berry fruits and rich texture. It's called Nuit Blanche (sleepless night) because the harvest takes place at night. Drink the wine now.

title: Millbrook 2014 Block Three East Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)
description: An engaging nose of spiced black berry, Thai basil and thyme make for an interesting and exotic start. A medium body of soft tannins and bright acidity houses loads of tart red berries that are broadened out by fleshier red plum. More herbal notes resound on the finish.

title: Mirabeau 2017 Azure Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is packed with crisp, red-berry flavors and finished with lively acidity. These elements make for a delicious, bright wine with flavor intensity as well as a zingy final texture. Drink now.

title: Müller-Grossmann 2017 Grosser Satz Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Tender notes of Conference pear on the nose have the slightest touch of lemon zest. On the palate much more fruit becomes apparent. Green and yellow pear, juicy apple and ripe lemon all make an appearance. The result is a soft, fruity, dry and light wine.

title: Nastl 2016 Klassik Cuvée Red (Weinland Österreich)
description: Juicy notes of black cherry on the nose are just as honestly and clearly present on the fresh palate. The body is full-fruited, joyful and has a lovely backbone of tannin and grip. This is pervaded by freshness and comes fresh-faced with disarming frankness. Enjoy.

title: North Coast All Stars 2016 Lichen Estate Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: More fruity and rich than many examples, this wine from a single vineyard in the cool Anderson Valley has a ripe apple aroma, mouthfilling apple and melon flavors and a smooth texture.

title: Ogier 2015 Artesis Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This wine's understated nose offers delicate whiffs of nut and toast amidst restrained black cherry and plum scents. The full-bodied, fleshy palate offers ample black fruit flavors, accented by elegant hints of dried herbs and firm, fine-grained tannins that extend the finish.

title: Paradise Springs 2013 PVT Red (Virginia)
description: Aromas of blackberry and black plum, fig, balsamic, cedar and spices are high toned in this Petit Verdot and Tannat blend. Highly extracted and full of intrigue, this offers well integrated tannins and vibrant acidity on the palate matched by a big mouthfeel. The finish is long and powerful but smooth.

title: Pratsch 2017 Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: Fragrant, lemon-scented and strawberry-kissed, the nose on this pale rosé is very inviting. A touch of spritz gives a little tingle on the light and dry palate: summer in a glass.

title: Producta Vignobles 2017 Mission St Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This bright, ripe wine offers a backdrop of ripe apples. Its mineral texture is now softening to broaden out into rich spice, pear and crisp lemon. Drink the wine from late 2018.

title: Renwood 2015 Sea of Grapes Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine has a profusion of mature spicy jammy flavors fueled by lavish oak and very rich ripe fruit. It starts with cedar, vanilla, and maple aromas and continues on the palate with blackberry and milk chocolate flavors carried by a broad texture. It's quite full bodied and moderately tannic.

title: Renwood 2015 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Sturdy and straightforward, this full-bodied dry wine combines the classic brambly, wild-berry aromas with good fruit flavors and moderate tannins. It's a no-nonsense wine that could be enjoyed often.

title: Renwood 2017 Zinfandel Rosé (Amador County)
description: Crisp and dry, this very pale-colored peachy tasting light-bodied wine has a lively character driven by good fruit acidity. It does a great job of cleansing the palate and will be extremely food friendly.

title: Rosa Nautica 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral aromas are honeyed and pleasant. Strong acidity gives teeth to the palate, while this tastes mostly of tangerine and lemon, with some tropical sweetness. A citrusy finish with golden-apple notes closes this out.

title: San Vito 2016  Chianti
description: Made from organically grown Sangiovese, this offers earthy aromas of red berry, underbrush and scorched soil. The lively palate offers raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper notes alongside supple tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2016 Organza White (Rioja)
description: Barrel-heavy aromas of raw oak and vanilla dominate the nose on this blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca. Lively acidity gives life and balance to a full resiny palate, while this tastes much like it smells: oaky and briny, with citrusy undertones. A mild finish that's nutty and salty is lasting.

title: Sleight of Hand 2016 The Conjurer Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This early release from this vintage is a blend of 43% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Cabernet Franc, 22% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot. The aromas lean into the green, with notes of savory fresh herb along with flower, plum, cherry, black currant and spice. Plush ripe blue- and black-fruit flavors provide appeal.

title: Sparkman 2017 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Oasis, Gamache and Olsen vineyards and was aged half in stainless steel with the rest in neutral barrels. It's a bit reduced out of the gate, opening up to reveal kiwi, citrus, pineapple and herb aromas. The bountiful tropical fruit flavors delight.
